summary: This is pretty chill, I like drawing snow, I was frozen in my seat for a day 'cause I enjoyed drawing this cool picture. :v...
caption:
This is pretty chill, I like drawing snow, I was frozen in my seat for a day ‘cause I enjoyed drawing this cool picture. :v

Anyway, enough of ice puns, hope you guys like this piece, Glaceon is the 6th popular on my poll, which you can’t see anymore. Glaceon are joint first favourites with Vaporeon for me, I really like blue things. :v I did use some of my old methods for this piece, specifically the trees with the snow method and the snowing itself.
I can’t remember what the next eeveelution was, but I’m gonna assume it’s Leafeon and then Flareon, and I’ll probably do a special one for Eevee, even though I draw them so much for pokemon-saviors pft.

Anyway, have an ice day! Don’t be cheeky.

blog.name: pokebiologist
blog.title: Pokémon Biology
blog.description: I'm Theodora, but you can call me Thea! I'm a Battle Girl turned Pokémon Researcher, and I'm excited to share my observations with you. Feel free to ask, submit, request, and share your own findings!

summary: What tips do you have for raising an Aerodactyl? I received one in a trade (despite the other trainer saying she'd give me a...
question: What tips do you have for raising an Aerodactyl? I received one in a trade (despite the other trainer saying she'd give me a Sandslash) and neither the Flying or Rock experts in my town have any experience with them. Aerodactyl gets along with my other Pokemon but I don't know what to feed him, how to exercise him or if I can even legally take him outside.
answer:
Aerodactyl can be challenging Pokémon to care for, mostly because of their diet. They often require whole carcasses, and usually have a hard time recognizing processed foods as edible. Additionally, their teeth have to be kept clean (there are a few tooth-cleaning treats available that are both big and tough enough to be effective for an Aerodactyl, I’d recommend buying those in bulk).

When it comes to hygiene otherwise, they are not very demanding. However, they do love a good sandpaper-ing now and again.

Legally, you are allowed to have just about any Pokémon outside in a non-heavily populated area. If you live in a city, I don’t think you could wander the farmer’s market with your buddy, but any designated training or area should be fine!

-Thea

summary: When it comes to regions, which one would you say has the most and least regulated battle styles? Or are all the rules pretty...
question: When it comes to regions, which one would you say has the most and least regulated battle styles? Or are all the rules pretty much the same between the leagues across regions?
answer:
Culturally, battle style can vary a lot in different regions. In terms of actual number of written rules, Kanto and Johto are pretty strict. However, many of those rules are more considered to be guidelines, or are only currently in effect in high-level competition. I suppose Alola is the least regulated, but they’re been changing that over recent years.

There are international rules for things like League championships that have more international connotations, but most laws that are intergovernmentally adopted are more about trade and travel.

-Thea

blog.name: friendsafariserver
blog.title: Friend Safari!
blog.description:
Friend Safari is a SFW, OC-friendly, paragraph-style roleplay server for main series Pokémon games. From Kanto to Alola, the whole Pokémon world is your Cloyster! Members of this server are allowed a total of four played characters, with at least one required to be canonical.

The server is run by a team of five mods who you can learn more about via the mods page. We cultivate an easygoing and open atmosphere, with member comfort and happiness being our top priority.

All of the links are in the drop down menu under Rowlet, labeled Pokémon! Hovering over each Pokémon will tell you what page they link to!

summary: Welcome to the Friend Safari! Friend Safari is a Discord-based paragraph roleplay group. With channels for every region,...
body:
Welcome to the Friend Safari!

Friend Safari is a Discord-based paragraph roleplay group. With channels for every region, multiple modes for character interactions, and plenty of in-character events, ours is an active and welcoming group always looking for new members! To learn more about our server, head over to our rules!

Reblog this ad, stop by our blog and check us out!

summary: I recently adopted a nice purrloin, but she keeps coming back with my neighbors stuff. I’ve tried getting her to wear a collar...
question: I recently adopted a nice purrloin, but she keeps coming back with my neighbors stuff. I’ve tried getting her to wear a collar with a soothe bell so they can hear her but she still manages to sneak out and steal stuff. How do I make her stop?
answer:
I’m afraid that the only foolproof solution is to not let her outside unsupervised. In the long run, that would be safer for her and would also protect any Pokémon she might hunt while she’s out.

-Thea
